title: Running LoL
body:
I just built myself a new pc to play League, but its having a hard time running it anywhere above Very Low settings. Also i get crazy fps lag when i step close to Dragon or Baron. Spec list:

Mobo: Gigabyte GA-78LMT-USB3
GPU: Gigabyte Windforce R7 370
CPU: AMD FX 6300 Six Core
RAM: 16gb of Crucial Ballistix DDR4 Memory
PSU: EVGA 500w Power Supply

I'm on 64bit Windows 10, if that makes a difference. Can anyone tell me if im doing anything wrong, or if i bought the wrong parts or something?

replies.body:
Wow, that's a pretty beefy rig you built there!

When you see FPS drops when approaching specific parts of the map, it's generally a sign that there are missing or corrupt game assets or that there are performance configurations that conflict with League. To address this, we have a nifty [FPS guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) that will take you through the most common solutions.

Let me know if this helped.

It seems to have helped a little bit, I disabled unnecessary programs and changed Windows to optimize performance. However I'm still not able to run the game well on Very High settings, which is really my goal.

I'm glad it helped a bit, but I understand wanting to run League on max settings. No one builds a sweet rig like that without maxing out some games.

Since you've worked through the FPS guide and still have issues, I recommend reaching out to our tech specialists by [submitting a ticket. ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) They have to tech know-how and skills to get you back on the rift with full-on shiny graphics.

It would expedite your ticket if you attached a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) along to your submission. 

Let me know if you have any questions.
